label: 郡司
本: Capital and Countryside in Japan, 300-1180:  Japanese Historians Interpreted in English . Cornell University East Asia Program . 2006
説明文: a district chieftain, who presided over a district office (gunga). They were generally hereditary officials (fudai), but they were overseen by the provincial governor. During Heian times, provincial governors could and did nominate new candidates for the post. [郡衙] [譜代]
